article.name: Download Video Modules from the ModStore
article.title: Download Video Modules from the ModStore
article.body:
In the ModStore, you can download video modules in MP4 or SCORM file format. Before you download video modules, we recommend that you add the modules to your library so you can track which videos you have downloaded. After you download a video module from the ModStore, your internet browser will either download the video module to your file manager or prompt you to save the video module to your file manager.

Important: If you are unable to find video module or training module files that are available for download, contact your Customer Success Manager. If you don't know who your Customer Success Manager is, contact our support team.

See the section below to learn how to download a video module and how your internet browser will download the video module to your file manager. For general information about our ModStore content, see our ModStore and Library Guide. 

Downloading Video Modules

To download a video module from the ModStore, follow the steps below:

  1. From the ModStore tab, hover your mouse over the video module that you would like to download.
  2. Click the View Details link. 
    Tip:If you already added the video module to your library, you can also access the video module from the Library subtab of the ModStore. From the Library subtab, click the information icon next to the module that you would like to download.
  3. Click the Download button. 
  4. From the Download Options pop-up window, click the Download link next to the video format you would like to download.

Internet Browser Behavior

When you click the Download button, your internet browser will either automatically download the video module or prompt you to save the file to your device. 

For information about the default settings for your browser, view the list below.

  • Firefox: By default, Firefox will prompt you to save the file. If you would like to change the file name or location after you click the OK button, you can do so by locating the file in your file manager. 
  • Google Chrome: By default, Google Chrome will prompt you to save the file. You can change the file name and location before you click the Save File radio button. 
  • Microsoft Edge: By default, Microsoft Edge will download the file to your Downloads folder. If you would like to change the file name or location, you can do so by locating the file in your file manager. 
  • Safari: By default, Safari will download the file to your Downloads folder. If you would like to change the file name or location, you can do so by locating the file in your file manager.

images.alt:
This image displays a section of a resource library interface, presented as a horizontal grid of content cards (video modules).

**Featured Content Card (Left Module):**
The primary focus is on the first content card, titled: **"The Inside Man: Season 1 Ep 00 - Full Trailer."** This module includes five distinct metadata fields:
1.  **Video Module** (Type indicator)
2.  **12** (Count/Usage metric)
3.  **March 2019** (Date)
4.  **2 min** (Duration)
5.  **Season 1, Episode 13** (Categorization)

Below the metadata are two prominent call-to-action buttons:
1.  A primary, blue button: **"+ Add to Library"**
2.  A secondary, white outlined button: **"View Details"**

The **"View Details"** button is highlighted with an orange rectangular border, indicating a hover state or system focus. A mouse cursor (pointer hand icon) is positioned over this button.

**Adjacent Content Cards (Context):**
The two subsequent cards visible to the right confirm the repetitive card structure and the series context:
*   Card 2 Title: **"The Inside Man: Season 4 Ep 12 - The Morning After"**
*   Card 3 Title: **"The Inside Man: Season 4 Ep 11 - Bittersweet"**

Both adjacent cards display **"Video Module"** and a usage count of **"32."**

The image displays a "Download Options" modal window overlaying a content detail page for a media item titled "Mindfulness: Delightful Meetings" (Series, Episode 3).

**Modal Structure and UI Elements:**

1.  **Title:** The modal is labeled "Download Options."
2.  **Language Selector:** A dropdown menu is positioned on the right side of the header, currently displaying the selection "English (Great Britain)."
3.  **Download Configurations:** A list presents three available export formats, organized with status tracking information where applicable, and a corresponding action link:
    *   **Format 1:** SCORM 2004 Revision 4, paired with the status tracking setting "Completed/Incomplete," and a "Download" link.
    *   **Format 2:** SCORM 1.2, paired with the status tracking setting "Completed/Incomplete," and a "Download" link.
    *   **Format 3:** MP4, followed directly by a "Download" link (status tracking setting is omitted for this file type).
4.  **Action Button:** The modal footer contains a single, blue, dismissive action button labeled **Cancel** located in the bottom right corner.
